review: A non-techie, even I could get this up and running within five minutes. The app is easy to use and so is the laptop interface. Could barely contain my glee when calling the local cable company to cancel my service! Works well with my MLB Network subscription, Netflix, etc. It is a bit "laggy" for live sports, but I'm not such a fanatic that it matters.  If you watch mostly movies/TV shows, you'll likely be quite pleased.Pros: Ease of use, valueCons: Lag time with live sports programming, works with a handful of apps
author: Amazon Customer

review: The chromecast is cheap and pretty easy to use, though we've had an issue with getting our TV to recognize the port it's plugged into. The feature of casting from phone is nice, though more selection would improve it.
author: seamouse

review: It's only 35 bucks and you can do so much more than what the ad page says if you're truly interested in pushing your tech to the next level. Then it's great for parties if everyone has their smart phones then they can all cast onto the big screen and it's super easy to set up. It's just such a great communal device as well as a personal one. I share a tv with my computer and it's much more relaxing to drop the keyboard and go on my tablet for a bit while casting Netflix or Youtube.
